trans-unit.source: A framework for playing the Diplomacy board game over a network.
trans-unit.target: A framework for playing the Diplomacy board game over a network.

trans-unit.source: Andrew Rose developed the network protocol used to connect clients to the server, and wrote a DLL implementation of it.
trans-unit.target: Andrew Rose developed the network protocol used to connect clients to the server, and wrote a DLL implementation of it.

trans-unit.source: Commands
trans-unit.target: 명령

trans-unit.source: Connects to a server, translating network messages to and from DAIDE message syntax on standard input and output.
trans-unit.target: Connects to a server, translating network messages to and from DAIDE message syntax on standard input and output.

trans-unit.source: Credits
trans-unit.target: 크레딧

trans-unit.source: Daniel Loeb started the Diplomacy Programming Project in 1990, developing a language for communication between computer players and a GM.
trans-unit.target: Daniel Loeb started the Diplomacy Programming Project in 1990, developing a language for communication between computer players and a GM.

trans-unit.source: David Norman extended the DPP communication language into the DAIDE message syntax, translated several variant maps into it, and wrote the first full-featured server, bot, and graphical player interface to use the DAIDE protocols.
trans-unit.target: David Norman extended the DPP communication language into the DAIDE message syntax, translated several variant maps into it, and wrote the first full-featured server, bot, and graphical player interface to use the DAIDE protocols.

trans-unit.source: Eric Wald wrote the first versions of Parlance to extend the DAIDE environment to non-Windows platforms, particularly Linux.
trans-unit.target: Eric Wald wrote the first versions of Parlance to extend the DAIDE environment to non-Windows platforms, particularly Linux.

trans-unit.source: Installation
trans-unit.target: 설치

trans-unit.source: Listens for clients, translating network messages to and from DAIDE message syntax on standard input and output.
trans-unit.target: Listens for clients, translating network messages to and from DAIDE message syntax on standard input and output.

trans-unit.source: Parlance also includes a framework for clients, along with a simple bot to replace an absent player. This framework has also been used by the clients of the Parang package.
trans-unit.target: Parlance also includes a framework for clients, along with a simple bot to replace an absent player. This framework has also been used by the clients of the Parang package.

trans-unit.source: Parlance can be installed with Easy Install from a command prompt:
trans-unit.target: Parlance can be installed with Easy Install from a command prompt:

trans-unit.source: Parlance installs the following commands:
trans-unit.target: Parlance installs the following commands:

trans-unit.source: Parlance is a framework for playing the Diplomacy board game over a network, using the protocol and message syntax developed by the Diplomacy AI Development Environment (DAIDE) community.
trans-unit.target: Parlance is a framework for playing the Diplomacy board game over a network, using the protocol and message syntax developed by the Diplomacy AI Development Environment (DAIDE) community.

trans-unit.source: Parlance may be used, modified, and/or redistributed under the terms of the Artistic License 2.0, as published by the Perl Foundation.
trans-unit.target: Parlance may be used, modified, and/or redistributed under the terms of the Artistic License 2.0, as published by the Perl Foundation.

trans-unit.source: Prints out an example configuration file
trans-unit.target: Prints out an example configuration file

trans-unit.source: Starts a game server
trans-unit.target: Starts a game server

trans-unit.source: Starts one or more HoldBots
trans-unit.target: Starts one or more HoldBots

trans-unit.source: The Parlance server differs from the official DAIDE server in that it can serve multiple games (consecutively or concurrently), is more configurable, can be managed remotely through admin commands, and accepts a slightly broader message syntax.
trans-unit.target: The Parlance server differs from the official DAIDE server in that it can serve multiple games (consecutively or concurrently), is more configurable, can be managed remotely through admin commands, and accepts a slightly broader message syntax.
